project_master_plan.project_name: iBrain: AP Calculus BC AI Tutor
project_master_plan.update_note: Major UX Overhaul: Shifted FRQ submission to Post-Exam Phase. Restored Mobile QR Handoff as primary upload method with PC fallback. Added Teacher Manual Upload Support. Optimized Exam UI for compact viewing.

roles.gemini: Architect (System Design, DB Schema, Logic Verification, Code Review)

updates: Implemented 'Submission Phase' logic: Uploads are strictly blocked during the exam and enabled only after time expires.
Restored 'Mobile QR Handoff' as the PRIMARY FRQ upload method.
Added 'PC File Upload' as a hidden fallback link (Emergency Use).
Refined 'OptionRadio': Compact Card design, Red 'X' Elimination tool, Fixed LaTeX limits (displaystyle) alignment.
Implemented 'Compact Mode': Reduced padding/margins to fit options on laptop screens without scrolling.
Added 'Manual Upload Support': Teachers can force-upload FRQ images for students.
Realtime Sync: Student screen instantly updates to 'Submitted' when Teacher performs manual upload.
Implemented 'Data Collection Zone' (Confidence + Used Calculator) in the footer.
Added 'Calculator Policy' badges in Header (No Calculator / Calculator Allowed).

mandatory_ai_guidelines.description: Strictly follow the 'Post-Exam Submission' flow. 1. Exam Timer Ends -> Screen Locks. 2. Show Submission Dashboard. 3. Student scans QR with Phone -> Uploads. 4. PC Screen auto-updates via Realtime.
If Student QR fails: 1. Use hidden PC upload link. 2. If that fails, Teacher uses 'Manual Upload Support' in Dashboard.
Always use displaystyle for limits and integrals. Use Flexbox for horizontal alignment. Ensure 'Elimination' (Red X) is available for all MCQ options.
